author: George Bellshaw
title: Jose Mourinho discusses difficulties in signing Arsenal players for Manchester United amid Mesut Ozil links
text:
Mourinho believes a deal would be tough to pull off (Picture: Getty) Jose Mourinho believes it’s tougher now for Manchester United to buy players from their Premier League rivals and doesn’t think he’ll be able to pull off a similar deal to Robin van Persie’s famous Arsenal exit under Sir Alex Ferguson.
Germany 1-0 England player ratings: Lallana and Alli shine as Podolski ends on a high The Portuguese coach admitted that signing players from the Gunners and north London rivals Tottenham Hotspur would now prove difficult for United and that the circumstances are very different from when he was first in charge of Chelsea.
In 2012, Van Persie swapped the Emirates for Old Trafford before firing United to the title – a move which infuriated Arsenal supporters.
There are fresh fears among the club’s fanbase that Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez could make a similar move to their Premier League rivals, particularly with the former’s close relationship to Mourinho.
Van Persie left Arsenal for Manchester United (Picture: Getty) But the United boss believes that any such deal would be near impossible.
‘Here, everyone is powerful now,’ he told France Football.
‘The scenery has changed. If I want to buy a player from Tottenham, I can’t.

‘Nor can I buy a player from Manchester City or Arsenal. That was not the case before.
‘At Chelsea, I brought in Shaun Wright-Phillips, who was the best player at Manchester City or Ashley Cole from Arsenal.
‘Sir Alex, when he wanted the best player from Tottenham, he bought Michael Carrick and then [Dimitar] Berbatov.’
